intro: Gratiola lobelioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf gravel root, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, yellowish-white flowers in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Gratiola lobelioides is a member of the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic compounds and medicinal uses.
